domain.removeConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove the domain
domain.removeTips: Remove the domain from Log Hub will not delete the Amazon OpenSearch domain in the AWS account.

proxy.name: Access Proxy
proxy.removeTips: Are you sure you want to delete the Access Proxy

list.clusterRed: ClusterStatus.red maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.clusterYellow: ClusterStatus.yellow maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.writeBlocked: ClusterIndexWritesBlocked is >= 1 for 5 minutes, 1 consecutive time
list.nodeUnreachable: Nodes minimum is < x for 1 day, 1 consecutive time
list.snapshotFailed: AutomatedSnapshotFailure maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.cpuUtilization: CPUUtilization or WarmCPUUtilization maximum is >= 80% for 15 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.jvmMemory: JVMMemoryPressure or WarmJVMMemoryPressure maximum is >= 80% for 5 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.masterCPU: MasterCPUUtilization maximum is >= 50% for 15 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.masterJVM: MasterJVMMemoryPressure maximum is >= 80% for 15 minutes, 1 consecutive time
list.kmsKeyDisabled: KMSKeyError is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.kmsKeyInAccess: KMSKeyInaccessible is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time

alarms.name: Alarms
alarms.removeTips: Are you sure you want to delete the Alarm

alarm.name: Create alarms
alarm.domainAlarmDesc: By enabling CloudWatch Alarms, you will receive notification of the status of the Open Search cluster.  This is the recommended alarms by Amazon OpenSearch. The created alarms will be sent to the same SNS Topic.
alarm.emailDesc: Notification will be sent to this email. Please click the link in your email to validate the email address.
alarm.emailFormatError: Email must be a validate format
alarm.selectAlarmTips: Please at least select one alarm option

proxy.name: Create access proxy
proxy.publicProxyDesc: Access Proxy is a Forward proxy to access the Kibana within the VPC. Enabling the proxy will create an ELB associated Nginx Auto Scaling Group and route web traffics from Internet to the Amazon OpenSearch built-in Kibana.
proxy.publicSubnetsDesc: Select the Subnets of the log processing layer. The Subnet must be connected to the Cluster.
proxy.publicSGDesc: Select a Security Group for the Application Load Balancer. This Security Group must have access to the Log Processing Security Group.
proxy.domainNameDesc: Input a domain name to associate with the access proxy. You will need to access the proxy via this domain.
proxy.domainNameFormatError: Domain Name required and must be a domain format.
proxy.lbSSLDesc1: Select the SSL certificate associated with the above domain name. You must create certificate in
proxy.nginxKeyNameDesc: Specify the EC2 Key Name of the Nginx proxy.
proxy.secureConnDesc: Connect the access proxy with HTTPS. You will need to have a Domain and SSL Certificate.
proxy.unsecureTips: The access proxy created will be accessed using unsecured connection. You will need to delete and re-create the access proxy if you change your mind later.
proxy.ackTips: I acknowledge that I choose to use unsecured connection.
proxy.ackError: Please acknowledge all checkboxes before proceeding.

selectDomain.domainDesc1: The cluster MUST be in the same region as this solution and must be VPC type. Or follow

configNetwork.autoDesc: Create a dedicated VPC for log processing layer and public access layer to connect to OpenSearch domain via VPC peering.
configNetwork.manualDesc: Manually specify the log processing layer and public access layer network settings.
configNetwork.layerNetworkDesc: Log Hub requires one Log Processing Subnet Group. The log processing functions will reside in the log processing subnet and use the associated Security Group.
configNetwork.configTipDesc: You have chosen a VPC other than the VPC of the selected Amazon OpenSearch domain. Please create VPC Peering, configure Route Table, and make sure the resources have access to the domain.
configNetwork.vpcDesc: Select the VPC of the log processing layer. The VPC must be the same VPC as the cluster or connected via VPC Peering.
configNetwork.logProcessSubnetGroupDesc: Select at least two subnets of the log processing layer. It is recommended to select private subnets.
configNetwork.logProcessSGDesc: Select a Security Group for the log processing layer. The Security Group must have access the OpenSearch domain.
